jcr:content.jcr:description: Worldline [Euronext: WLN], the European leader in payment and transactional services, strengthens its partnership with devolo AG, the leading European company on the market in Powerline communication solutions. As part of the partnership, devolo will provide its OEM products for a Worldline secured cloud solution. With Worldline Home Control, end-users are able to manage their networked devices on-the-go via their smartphone and/or tablet, while transmitted private data and information is secured. Visitors can experience and test the joint solution from devolo and Worldline from September, 2nd to 7th at the 2016 IFA in hall 11.1 booth 33.
jcr:content.jcr:title: Secured Smart Home with Worldline and devolo

richtext.text:
Frankfurt/Main, 02.08.2016 - Worldline [Euronext: WLN], the European leader in payment and transactional services, strengthens its partnership with devolo AG, the leading European company on the market in Powerline communication solutions. As part of the partnership, devolo will provide its OEM products for a Worldline secured cloud solution. With Worldline Home Control, end-users are able to manage their networked devices on-the-go via their smartphone and/or tablet, while transmitted private data and information is secured. Visitors can experience and test the joint solution from devolo and Worldline from September, 2nd to 7th at the 2016 IFA in hall 11.1 booth 33.

The joint solution targets multi-service operators (MSO), such as Mobile Networks Operators, cable operators, utilities and insurance companies. With the solution they can offer their customers improved services, seamless control and a high level of security.

With Worldline Home Control, end-users have everything in the palm of their hand: from thermostats, window and door sensors, and also smoke detectors. They can always monitor the status of the devices via their smartphone and/or tablet and also control them remotely.

The necessary protection of data transmitted between devices is guaranteed by Worldline thanks to its secured Cloud-based solutions. Worldline ensures that not only authorized users can access the data but also that the transmitted information is encrypted.


Olivier Stuckens, Managing Director of Mobility & e-Transactional Services at Worldline: “Because of the Internet of Things, Connected Living solutions are becoming increasingly more important and are in high demand on the consumers’ end. The safety and privacy aspect is therefore of essential importance for consumers. Together with devolo AG we answer to an ever changing environment which requires more security, interoperability and innovative services for end-users.”
Werner Fehn, Vice President Operator Solutions at devolo AG, adds: “Today end-users want not only the best possible TV, streaming and internet services - but they also want to monitor their home on-the-go. This request is addressed by this solution. With Worldline as a trusted partner, we can offer customized and secured solutions to B2B customers.”

Multi-Service Operators and end-users can discover the joint solution at the IFA in Berlin from September, 2nd to 7th. in TecWatch hall 11.1 on booth 33 where devolo and Worldline will present the "devolo Home Control Demo House". Visitors can test different scenarios on site with provided mobile devices to control lighting, thermostats and other electrical equipment in a recreated home-like environment. Furthermore, experts from Worldline and devolo will explain how the security at home can be monitored while they are away with smoke detectors, motion detectors and door sensors.

Note to press contacts:

It is already possible to arrange interview appointments with the Worldline and devolo experts on site at the 2016 IFA and on the phone. Interviews with Worldline can be arranged by sending an email to atos@akima.de or by calling 089/17 959 18-0.


About Worldline

Worldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. Worldline delivers new-generation services, enabling its customers to offer smooth and innovative solutions to the end consumer. Key actor for B2B2C industries, with over 40 years of experience, Worldline supports and contributes to the success of all businesses and administrative services in a perpetually evolving market. Worldline offers a unique and flexible business model built around a global and growing portfolio, thus enabling end-to-end support. Worldline activities are organized around three axes: Merchant Services & Terminals, Mobility & e-Transactional Services, Financial Processing & Software Licensing. Worldline employs more than 7,300 people worldwide and generated 1.22 billion euros revenues in 2015. Worldline is an Atos company. worldline.com

About devolo

devolo AG is the leading European company on the market in Powerline communication solutions. The company's core product is dLAN®, a technology that allows flexible networks over existing wiring such as electrical and coaxial lines. Powerline solutions are employed in private households as well as commercial environments and they lead the way in future-oriented energy data distribution and home automation. devolo invests its development resources into improving dLAN® technology through its own patented solutions. The globally operating company has been the world market leader in the Powerline segment since 2009. Numerous top-product test reviews and awards, not to mention over 30 million sold adapters, demonstrate devolo's success. Through sustainable market practices, devolo upholds its responsibility to customers, employees and the environment.
